title: Charles Babbage and the Analytical Engine
description: A fast breakdown of Charles Babbage and the Analytical Engine for builders.

hook.text: In the 1830s, a British mathematician designed a general-purpose computer â€” with gears and steam.

buildup.text: Charles Babbage envisioned the Analytical Engine with memory, a processor, and conditional branching.

discovery.text: His machine anticipated every fundamental concept of modern computing over a century early.

twist.text: The British government pulled funding. Babbage never completed his machine and died frustrated.

climax.text: Modern engineers built his designs. They work perfectly. Babbage was right all along.

punchline.text: He invented the computer before electricity.

quiz.question: Why was Babbage's Analytical Engine never completed?
options: He lost interest in the project
